title: Snippit
header: A responsive web app for reading, writing, and modifying code with customizable fonts, text sizes, padding, and light/dark themes — supporting multiple languages and allowing export as PDF, JPG, or shareable links.
description: A clean, searchable Pokémon showcase built with React and pure CSS. It fetches detailed data like type, stats, and abilities using complex API structures.
features: Search functionality to filter Pokémon by name instantly.
Displays Pokémon info like type, size, stats, abilities, and experience.
Utilizes nested `.map()` methods to extract data from complex API responses.
Responsive UI styled using pure CSS without any utility frameworks.
Loader/Spinner UI while data is being fetched.
Error handling for invalid or failed API responses.
whatILearned: Learned how to work with complex and nested REST APIs using the Pokémon API.
Improved skills in advanced CSS design and responsive layout techniques.
Implemented functional search and filtering UI logic in React.
Understood how to structure dynamic API data into clean, user-friendly components.

title: Info-Nation
header: A multi-section React application using modern routing and real-world API practices.
description: A modular React project combining multiple small components like Country Explorer, API CRUD practice, Accordion, and more — all built with the latest React Router DOM.
features: Home: A simple landing page with header, footer, image, and link to Country section.
Country: Fetches and displays all country data with search, sort (ASC/DESC), filter by region, and detailed country pages.
About: Shows interesting facts about 10 countries using modern CSS layout and animation.
Contact: A form to input name, email, and message — logs data to console instead of sending.
Accordion: Displays 5 React-related Q&A sections using interactive accordion UI.
API Practice: Add/Edit/Delete items using real APIs and controlled inputs styled with CSS3.
GitHub: External link redirects to my GitHub profile.
whatILearned: Gained practical experience with React Router DOM for multi-page navigation.
Worked with multiple APIs including Country API and JSONPlaceholder.
Built full CRUD functionality — including search, add, delete, and update operations.
Learned state management strategies for API-heavy applications using React hooks.
